name: M4_1_2 Load Data in the Warehous

content.query:
COPY INTO Staging.DimProducts
(AlternateKey 1, BrandName 2, Name 3, Price 4)
FROM 'https://4dnsynapselake.dfs.core.windows.net/files/sales_small/csv/products*.csv'
WITH
(
	FILE_TYPE = 'CSV'
	,MAXERRORS = 0
	,FIRSTROW = 2
	,ERRORFILE = 'https://4dnsynapselake.dfs.core.windows.net/files/'
    ,IDENTITY_INSERT = 'OFF'
)
GO;

COPY INTO Staging.DimCustomers
(AlternateKey 1, FirstName 2, LastName 3, CompanyName 4, StreetName 5, Number 6, City 7, Region 8, Country 9)
FROM 'https://4dnsynapselake.dfs.core.windows.net/files/sales_small/csv/customers_*.csv'
WITH
(
	FILE_TYPE = 'CSV'
	,MAXERRORS = 0
	,FIRSTROW = 2
	,ERRORFILE = 'https://4dnsynapselake.dfs.core.windows.net/files/'
    ,IDENTITY_INSERT = 'OFF'
)
GO;

COPY INTO Staging.FactOrders
(Id 1,  Quantity 2, TotalPrice 3, OrderDate 4, CustomerId 5, ProductId 6)
FROM 'https://4dnsynapselake.dfs.core.windows.net/files/sales_small/csv/orders_*.csv'
WITH
(
	FILE_TYPE = 'CSV'
	,MAXERRORS = 0
	,FIRSTROW = 2
	,ERRORFILE = 'https://4dnsynapselake.dfs.core.windows.net/files/'
)
GO

-- Next Update DimTables and update staging
-- First the DimDates table. Can be time consuming
-- Temp tables are really temp. Will be gone after execution so select the whole statment (better us this in a stored procedure)
CREATE TABLE #TmpStageDate (DateVal DATE NOT NULL)

-- Populate the temp table with a range of dates
DECLARE @StartDate DATE;
DECLARE @EndDate DATE;
SET @StartDate='2019-01-01';
SET @EndDate=GETDATE();
DECLARE @LoopDate DATE = @StartDate;
WHILE @LoopDate<=@EndDate
BEGIN
    INSERT INTO #TmpStageDate VALUES
    (
        @LoopDate
    )
    SET @LoopDate = DATEADD(dd, 1, @LoopDate)
END
--SELECT * FROM #TmpStageDate

-- Insert the dates and calculated attributes into the dimension table
INSERT INTO Main.DimDates
SELECT CAST(CONVERT(VARCHAR(8), DateVal, 112) as INT), -- date key
    DateVal, --date alt key
    Day(DateVal), -- day number of month
    DATEPART(WEEKDAY, DateVal),
	DATENAME(WEEKDAY, DateVal),
	DATEPART(MONTH, DateVal),
	DATENAME(MONTH, DateVal),
	DATEPART(QUARTER, DateVal),
	DATEPART(YEAR, DateVal)
FROM #TmpStageDate
GO

DROP TABLE #TmpStageDate

-- Next update the staging orders table
